com.example.colibris.multi.hypergraph

Class HyperConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.colibris.multi.hypergraph.HyperConnection

  • public class HyperConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    The HyperConnection class represents a edge-weighted hypergraph composed of vertices named 0 through V - where each directed hypereedge is of type HyperEdge and is composed of a set of inner-edges.

      • getHyperEdge

        public HyperEdge getHyperEdge(HyperEdge h2get)
        Check is the provided hyperedge is valid if yes, it returns the hyperedge. Otherwise,an empty hyperedge is returned
        Parameters:
        h2get - hyper edge
        Returns:
        hyperedge

      • addHyperEdge

        public void addHyperEdge(HyperEdge h2add)
        Add the provided hyperedge. if this hyperedge does not exist in the hypergraph, then add it else if this hyperedge already exists, then replace it with the one with minimal weight
        Parameters:
        h2add - hyperedge to add

      • spanning2ref

        public void spanning2ref(int hyperedgeNB,
                         int hyperedgeCard,
                         int from)
        create a spanning hypergraph
        Parameters:
        hyperedgeNB - number of hyper edges in the hypergraph
        hyperedgeCard - number of edges in the hypergraph
        from - source of the spaning hypergraph
